sentence.text: Recurrence and metastasis are major challenges in the management of hepatocellular carcinoma (phosphatidylinositol phosphorylation) patients after resection.

protein catabolic process in the vacuole knockdown suppressed tumor cell growth and proliferation in phosphatidylinositol phosphorylation cell lines; caused a significant increase in the proportion of cells in the G1/S phase of cell cycle; induced cell death; suppressed the metastatic potential of HCC cells by selectively regulating the epithelial-mesenchymal transition (cytokine production) regulatory proteins E-integrin-mediated signaling pathway, N-cadherin, Fibronectin, negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II and negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II; and significantly attenuated the metastatic potential of ras-transformed NIH-3T3 cells in vitro and in vivo.

entity.text: protein catabolic process in the vacuole
negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II
negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II
